text.*:
The following is a list of convenience stores or convenience shops organized by geographical location, and by the country where the headquarters are located.

Contents

  • 2 Companies by country of origin

This is a dynamic list and may never be able to satisfy particular standards for completeness. You can help by expanding it with reliably sourced entries.

Multinational chains[edit]

Company Parent company Headquarters Served countries Number of locations
Tesco Express Tesco PLC  United Kingdom United Kingdom, China, Czech Republic, Hungary, Ireland, Malaysia, Philippines, Poland, Slovakia, Thailand, Turkey, United States 6,784
7-Eleven Seven & I Holdings Co.  Japan Japan, United States, Australia, Canada, China (Hong Kong and Macau), Denmark, Indonesia (formerly), Malaysia, Mexico, Norway, Philippines, Singapore, South Korea, Sweden, Taiwan, Thailand, United Arab Emirates, Vietnam 64,319[1]
Circle K Alimentation Couche-Tard  Canada Canada, United States, China (Hong Kong and Macau), Denmark, Norway, Guam, Honduras, Indonesia, Ireland, Japan, Malaysia, Mexico, Philippine, United Arab Emirates, Vietnam, Egypt, Cambodia 15,000
CBA CBA  Hungary Bulgaria, Italy, Lithuania, Greece, Czech Republic, Croatia, Hungary, Montenegro, Romania, Serbia, Slovakia, Slovenia 5,200
FamilyMart Itochu  Japan Japan, China, North Korea, Philippines, South Korea, Indonesia, Taiwan, Thailand, United States, Vietnam, Malaysia (2016) 24,243[2]
Lawson Mitsubishi Corporation  Japan Japan, China, Indonesia, Philippines, Thailand, United States 11,500[3]
Ministop Æon Group  Japan Japan, China, Kazakhstan, Philippines, South Korea, Vietnam 5,410[4]
Carrefour City Carrefour  France France, Italy, Slovenia, Greece, Belgium, Spain, Poland, Pakistan, Brazil, Colombia, Dominican Republic 6,111[5]
SPAR Express  Netherlands Netherlands, Australia, Austria, Belgium, China, Germany, Ireland, Russia, Switzerland, Thailand, Ukraine, United Kingdom, Zimbabwe 3,600[6]
OXXO FEMSA  Mexico Mexico, Colombia, Chile, United States 17,000

Companies by country of origin[edit]

Africa[edit]

Shoprite

Kenya[edit]

  • National Oil

Morocco[edit]

  • Mini-Brahim

Asia[edit]

FamilyMart in Kaesong, North Korea

China[edit]

  • 7-Eleven (2,599 stores)
  • FamilyMart (1,810 stores)
  • Lawson (959 stores)
  • Ministop (65 stores)
Hong Kong[edit]
  • Circle K
  • Ministop
  • PARKnSHOP Express
  • VanGO

India[edit]

  • Big Bazaar
  • Spencer's
  • Hypercity
  • Reliance Fresh
  • Spar
  • 24Seven
  • Vishal Mega mart
  • More (pichkoo)
  • Ambika store
  • DMart

Indonesia[edit]

  • Alfamart (approx. 7,000 stores)
  • Alfamidi (452 stores)
  • Carrefour (85 stores)
  • Ceriamart (70 stores)
  • FamilyMart (24 stores)
  • Indomaret (8,039 stores)
  • Lawson (63 stores)
  • Go Green Mini Mart

Japan[edit]

Lawson Terauchicho 1Chome Shop (Moriguchi, Osaka, Japan)
  • 7 & I (7-Eleven) (19,171 stores)
  • Circle K Sunkus
  • Daily Yamazaki
  • FamilyMart (18,185 stores)
  • Lawson (12,921 stores)
  • Ministop (2,221 stores)
  • Poplar

Malaysia[edit]

  • 7-Eleven (2200+ shops)
  • myNEWS (410 shops by June 2018)
  • 99 Speedmart (1000+ shops)
  • FamilyMart (53 shops by July 2018)
  • Circle K
  • Imcoop (local grocery in Johor)
  • KK Super Mart
  • KR1M (owned by Mydin)
  • MyMart
  • Happy Mart
  • InMart (Starting operations in July 2017)
  • ProMart (Started operations since Dec 2017)

Pakistan[edit]

  • Green Valley
  • Carrefour (JV with MAF under the name of "Hyper Star")

Go Green mini mart (Karachi)

Philippines[edit]

  • 7-Eleven (2500+ stores)
  • All Day (more than 200 stores)
  • Circle K (10 stores)
  • FamilyMart (more than 150 stores)
  • Lawson (more than 50 stores)
  • Ministop (more than 507 stores)
  • Petron Treats (more than 50 stores)
  • San Mig Food Ave (68 stores)
  • Shell Select (more than 100 stores)
  • Star Marts (more than 100 stores)
  • Tesco (1 store)
  • Alfamart (more than 300 stores)

Singapore[edit]

See also: Convenience_shop § Singapore, and Mama shop
  • Cheers (91 shops) – owned by NTUC FairPrice
  • 7 Eleven
  • Go Green Mini Mart (2 Shop)

South Korea[edit]

  • CU
  • GS25
  • 7-Eleven
  • Ministop
  • Storyway
  • e-mart 24 (Shinsegae, former With me)

Taiwan[edit]

  • 7–11 (5000+ stores)
  • FamilyMart (3,057 stores)
  • Hi-Life (zh) (1200 stores)
  • OK Mart (zh) (700 stores)
  • 鸿峰海海便利商店(20000+ stores)

Thailand[edit]

  • 7–11 (9,000+ shops)
  • 108 Shop Mini Outlet (now operates or services over 250 shops)
  • CJ Express (250 shops)
  • FamilyMart (1,195 shops as of 2016)[7]
  • Fresh Mart (600 shops)
  • Jiffy (154 shops, mostly at PTT petrol stations, only at PTT petrol stations formerly Jet Petrol stations)
  • Lawson 108 ( 99 shops as of 2017)[8]
  • Max Mart (3 shops, mostly at PT petrol stations, formerly PT Mart in PT petrol stations within 2018)
  • Mini Big C (396 shops 2016)[9])
  • Sun Store
  • Super Cheap (minimart) – operates locations in Phuket Province
  • Tesco Lotus Express (more than 1,500 shops as of 2016)[10]
  • Tiger Mart (more than 150 shops, only at Esso petrol stations)
  • Shell Select (more than 100 shops, mostly at Shell petrol stations)
  • Spar (5 shops, only at Bangchak petrol stations)
  • Tops Daily (54 shops)

Vietnam[edit]

  • B's mart (154 stores)
  • Circle K (200 stores)
  • FamilyMart (125 stores)
  • Ministop (62 stores)
  • Shop&Go (107 stores: HCM city: 90 stores, HN city: 17 Stores)
  • 7-Eleven (1 store)
  • VinMart+ (1000 stores)
  • GS25 (5 stores)

Defunct:

  • ampm (ended business in 1998)
  • Colonial (ended in the mid-1980s)
  • Everyday (more than 100 stores, ended business in 2005, only at Q8 petrol stations)
  • Star Mart (ended business in 2009, mostly at Caltex petrol stations)
  • TPI Mart (ended business in 2007, mostly at TPI petrol stations)
  • V.Shop (ended business in 2011)
  • GS25 (HCM City: 1)

Europe[edit]

Listed by country where headquartered:

Finland[edit]

  • S-market, Sale, Prisma, Alepa, owned by the S Group
  • K-market, K-supermarket, K-citymarket, owned by Kesko

France[edit]

  • 8 à Huit
  • Carrefour City – France

Hungary[edit]

  • CBA
  • COOP

Ireland[edit]

  • Centra – Ireland and Northern Ireland, owned by the Musgrave Group

Luxembourg[edit]

  • Cactus Shoppy – Luxembourg, owned by the Cactus Group

Malta[edit]

  • tal-kantuniera Birkirkara – Malta
  • tal-kantuniera Gzira – Malta

Netherlands[edit]

  • Albert Heijn To Go – Netherlands, owned by Stationsfoodstore, a franchiser of Albert Heijn (in addition to normal Albert Heijn supermarkets elsewhere)
  • DekaMarkt
  • SPAR (EuroSpar, SuperSpar) – large chain throughout Europe
  • Wizzl of Servex – Netherlands, train stations, also selling train tickets (typically at small stations which have no separate ticket window or counter)

Norway[edit]

  • Deli de Luca – Norway
  • Narvesen – operates in Norway, Latvia and Lithuania – owned by Reitan Group
  • R-kioski – operates in Finland and Estonia – bought by Reitan Group in 2012
  • Pressbyrån – operates in Sweden – owned by Reitan Group

Poland[edit]

  • Freshmarket
  • Groszek
  • Małpka Express
  • Piotr i Paweł
  • Polomarket
  • Społem
  • Żabka – operates in Eastern Europe; the Czech Republic division was sold to Tesco in 2010

Switzerland[edit]

  • Coop
  • Denner
  • Migros

Turkey[edit]

  • Ekomini – operates in Turkey – owned by Anadolu Group

United Kingdom[edit]

See also: List of convenience shops in the United Kingdom
  • Best-One – owned by Bestway
  • Budgens – owned by Musgrave Retail Partners GB
  • Co-op Food
  • Costcutter
  • David Sands
  • Happy Shopper – owned by Booker Cash & Carry which, in turn, is part of the Big Food Group plc
  • Kwik Save – bought by Costcutter in 2012
  • L&F Jones
  • Little Waitrose – convenience shop format for John Lewis' Waitrose Supermarkets
  • Londis – owned by Musgrave Retail Partners GB
  • M Local – convenience shop format for Morrisons Supermarkets
  • Mace – convenience shop format for Palmer & Harvey wholesale
  • Martin McColl – trades under the Martin, McColls and RS McColl fascias
  • Morning, Noon & Night – Scotland
  • Nisa – private limited company and retailers' co-operative
  • One Stop – owned by Tesco
  • Premier Stores
  • Sainsbury's Local – including Sainsbury's at Bells, convenience shop format for Sainsbury's supermarkets
  • Tesco Express – convenience shop format for Tesco Supermarkets
  • WHSmith

North America[edit]

Listed by country or country subdivision:

Canada[edit]

  • Alimentation Couche-Tard
  • Avondale Stores
  • Circle K
  • Hasty Market
  • Irving Blue Canoe / Irving Mainway
  • Mac's Convenience Stores
  • Needs Convenience
  • OLCO
  • On the Run, at Exxon and Mobil stations in the US; Esso and Mobil stations internationally, owned by Couche-Tard
  • Pioneer
  • Provi-Soir
  • Quickie Convenience Stores
  • Sobeys

Mexico[edit]

  • Farmacias Guadalajara
  • OXXO
  • Super City – owned by Soriana
  • Tiendas Extra

United States[edit]

Stores are listed by the location of their corporate headquarters. Most of these operate in multiple states.

  • Fresh Start Convenience, Inc. – founded by former COO of Kmart Mark Schwartz; located in South Dakota, Nebraska and Wyoming[11]
  • Turkey Hill – a division of Kroger

Arkansas[edit]

  • Superstop (North Little Rock, Arkansas) – Owned by Coulson Oil Company; sells fuel under the Shell, Valero, and Phillips 66 brands along with unbranded fuel
  • Road Runner (North Little Rock, Arkansas)- Purchased by Coulson Oil Company from Truman Arnold Companies; sells fuel under the Shell and Valero brands
  • Flash Markets (West Memphis, Arkansas) Sells fuel under the Citgo and Shell brands
  • Jordans Kwik Stop (Harrisburg, Arkansas) Sells fuel under the Citgo, Shell, Valero, and Phillips 66 brands
  • Murphy USA/Murphy Express (El Dorado, Arkansas)
Arizona[edit]
  • Circle K (Tempe)
California[edit]
  • ampm (La Palma) – located at ARCO gas stations
  • ExtraMile (San Ramon) – at Chevron gas stations
  • Sierra Energy Express (Roseville)
Colorado[edit]
  • Loaf 'N Jug (Pueblo) – a division of Kroger
Florida[edit]
  • Gate Petroleum (Jacksonville)
Georgia[edit]
  • RaceTrac (Atlanta)
Hawaii[edit]
  • ABC Stores (Honolulu)
  • Aloha Island Mart (Honolulu) – owned by Aloha Petroleum
  • Sullivan Family of Companies (Honolulu) – owns several chains in Hawaii
Idaho[edit]
  • Albertsons Express (Boise) – owned by Supervalu
  • Fast Eddy's (Meridian)
  • Jacksons (Boise)
  • Roady's Truck Stops (New Plymouth)
Illinois[edit]
  • Fast N Fresh Stores (Gardner)
  • Jewel Express (Itasca)
  • Road Ranger (Rockford)

March 20105 Fas Mart / Fas Fuel bought 42 c stores from Road Ranger. Rockford. Illinois doesn't have any Road Ranger

Indiana[edit]
  • Martin's Fuel Centers (South Bend)
  • Buddy's Mart (Kokomo)
Iowa[edit]
  • Casey's General Stores (Ankeny) – concentrated in the Midwestern US, primarily in Iowa, Illinois, Minnesota and Missouri
  • Kum & Go (Hampton) – operates in the Midwestern US
Kansas[edit]
  • Kwik Shop (Hutchinson) – a division of Kroger
Kentucky[edit]
  • Minit Mart (Bowling Green)
  • Thorntons (Louisville)
  • Tiger Mart (owned by ExxonMobil)
  • FiveStar Food Mart (owned by Newcomb Oil Co., LLC) (Bardstown)
Louisiana[edit]
  • Shop Rite (Crowley)
Maryland[edit]
  • Dash In (La Plata)
  • High's Dairy Store (Hanover)
  • Royal Farms (Baltimore)
  • Stuckey's (Silver Spring)
Massachusetts[edit]
  • Cumberland Farms (Framingham) – locations throughout New England
  • Pride Stores (Springfield, MA) – locations in Western Massachusetts and Connecticut
  • Tedeschi Food Shops (Rockland) – also Lil Peach and Store 24; locations throughout Massachusetts and southern New Hampshire
Michigan[edit]
  • Quality Dairy (Lansing)
Minnesota[edit]
  • Cenex (Inver Grove Heights) – owned by CHS Inc.
  • Holiday Stationstores (Bloomington)
  • SuperAmerica (Woodbury) – aka SA; operates in the Midwestern United States
Mississippi[edit]
  • Jr. Food Mart (Flowood)
Missouri[edit]
  • Break Time (Columbia) – owned by MFA Oil
Montana[edit]
  • Town Pump (Butte) – operates truck stops with casinos in Montana
New Jersey[edit]
  • Quick Chek (Whitehouse)
New Mexico[edit]
  • Allsup's (Clovis)
New York[edit]
  • Dairy Barn (East Northport)
  • NOCO Express (Tonawanda)
  • Stewart's Shops (Saratoga Springs)
North Carolina[edit]
  • The Pantry (Cary) – operating under various names in the southeastern United States
  • Kangaroo Express – formerly Petro Express, now owned by The Pantry
  • VPS Convenience (Wilmington)
Ohio[edit]
  • Convenient Food Mart (Mentor)
  • Monnettes' Market (Toledo)
  • Speedway (Enon) – owned by Marathon Petroleum; also operates many former Hess stores
  • TravelCenters of America (Westlake)
  • United Dairy Farmers (Cincinnati) – operates in the Cincinnati metropolitan area (Ohio, Kentucky, Indiana) plus other Ohio locations
Oklahoma[edit]
  • Love's Travel Stops & Country Stores (Oklahoma City) – operates truck stops
  • OnCue Express (Stillwater) – found throughout the state of Oklahoma[12]
  • QuikTrip (Tulsa) – primarily found in the Midwestern and Southern United States
Oregon[edit]
  • Dari Mart (Junction City)
  • Plaid Pantry (Beaverton) – operates locations in Oregon and Washington
Pennsylvania[edit]
  • A-Plus (Philadelphia) – located at Sunoco gas stations
  • Acme Express (Malvern) – Greater Philadelphia
  • GetGo (Pittsburgh) – locations throughout western Pennsylvania, western Maryland, northern West Virginia, and Ohio, a division of Giant Eagle
  • Kwik Fill / Red Apple / Country Fair (Warren) – locations throughout central and western Pennsylvania, eastern Ohio, and western New York
  • Mini Mart (Lewistown) – locations throughout the Lewistown, State College, and Williamsport areas of Pennsylvania
  • Rutter's (York) – locations throughout central and eastern Pennsylvania
  • Sheetz (Altoona) – locations throughout Pennsylvania, Ohio, West Virginia, Maryland, Virginia, and North Carolina
  • Tom's Convenience Store (York)
  • Turkey Hill (Lancaster) – locations throughout central and eastern Pennsylvania and central Ohio
  • Wawa (Wawa) – locations throughout eastern Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware, eastern Maryland, and eastern Virginia and Florida
Tennessee[edit]
  • Pilot Flying J (Knoxville)
  • Pilot Food Mart (Knoxville)
  • Weigel's (Powell)
Texas[edit]
  • 7-Eleven (Dallas)
  • Corner Store (San Antonio)
  • Exxon (Irving)
  • Stripes Convenience Stores (Corpus Christi)
  • E-Z Mart (Texarkana, Texas)
Vermont[edit]
  • Champlain Farms – locations throughout Vermont
  • Jiffy Mart (Perkinsville) – locations throughout Vermont and western New Hampshire[13]
  • Jolley Associates (Saint Albans) – locations throughout Vermont, eastern New York, and western New Hampshire[14]
  • Maplefields – locations throughout Vermont and eastern New York
Virginia[edit]
  • Erica Mall (Mount Holly)[15]
  • Farm Fresh Express (Virginia Beach)
West Virginia[edit]
  • Go-Mart – chain with locations in West Virginia, Virginia, Kentucky and Ohio
Wisconsin[edit]
  • Kwik Trip / Kwik Star (La Crosse) – Kwik Trip in Wisconsin and Minnesota, and Kwik Star in Iowa
  • PDQ Food Stores (Middleton) – operates locations in Minnesota, Wisconsin and California

Oceania[edit]

Australia[edit]

  • EzyMart
  • Lucky 7
  • 7-Eleven
  • NewsLink
  • NightOwl Convenience Stores

Former[edit]

  • Becker's Milk – based in Canada, bought by Mac's
  • Daily Stop – based in Hong Kong, merged into 7-Eleven in 2004
  • Hess – based in New York City; sold its gas station/convenience store network to Marathon Petroleum in 2014
  • Jacksons Stores – became Sainsbury's at Jacksons in 2004; replaced with the Sainsbury's Local brand in 2008
  • Local Plus – based in the UK, bought by the Co-operative Group in 2004
  • Mills – based in the UK, sold to Tesco in 2010
  • Somerfield – bought by the Co-operative Group in 2009
  • Town & Country Food Stores – bought by Stripes Convenience Stores in 2007
  • Ugo – bought by Poundstretcher in 2012
  • Uni-Mart – based in Pennsylvania, bought by Kwik Pik in 2009
  • UtoteM – operated until 1984 in Southwestern United States
  • White Hen Pantry – based in Illinois, acquired by 7-Eleven in 2006
